column5: Evening all,  Heading out to a lake in the Bancroft region in a week.  The lake is active with smalls, large and Lakers.  I have a nice pontoon boat and I'm looking for advice as to how to set up my rig for each of these species.  Things like baits and depths would help a great deal.  Thanks in advance,  MJP

If you are going for bass, my go to spots up there are 8-10 feet of water.  Look for weedbeds that come near the surface.  Fish senkos, Texas rigged and if winds are calm go weightless.   Also fishing weeds close to shore in about 3 feet of water also produces.  Good luck!!
Thanks ccmt,  Are we talking specifically for smallmouth, largemouth or both?
More for largies....but smallies will take them too.
Cast 6 inch Sluggos on a 5/0 gammy wg weightless. Cast to the shoreline pull slowly off the shore into the water. twitch pause and hang on. Theres big fish in under a foot of water.
